snippet: A Times/CBS News poll finds that, although many Republicans have reservations about Mr. Trump, he appears to be gaining acceptance.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News Poll shows increasing number of Republican voters think Donald J Trump has best chance of winning 2016 presidential election as party's nominee; 39 percent of voters believe Trump is most likely to win, up from 26 percent in August; polls show falling support for Democratic candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MEGAN THEE-BRENAN

lead_paragraph: A Times/CBS News poll finds that, although many Republicans have reservations about Mr. Trump, he appears to be gaining acceptance.

headline.main: More Republicans See Donald Trump as a Winner, Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: More in G.O.P. See Trump as Winner, Poll Finds
